## Statistical Techniques

#### [**Institute for Social Research (ISR) Population Dynamics and Health Program Workshops**](https://pdhp.isr.umich.edu/workshops/past/) **- Video**

> A listing of past virtual workshops on various statistical techniques

#### [**Consulting for Statistics, Computing, & Analytics Research (CSCAR) Workshops**](https://cscar.research.umich.edu/events/category/workshops/) **- Events**

> A listing of upcoming in-person workshops on various statistical techniques

#### [**Statistical Inference via Data Science: A ModernDive into R and the Tidyverse**](https://moderndive.com/index.html) **- Textbook**

> The companion website to Chester Ismay and Albert Y. Kim's introductory statistics textbook, which walks students through the entire data analysis pipeline using R and tidyverse

#### [**Statistics Course for Data Science**](https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLqzoL9-eJTNBZDG8jaNuhap1C9q6VHyVa&si=gZmsZ4IC8WBkzl4r) **- Video**

> The Statistics for Data Science Course covers statistical concepts taught in many intro and intermediate statistics courses in universities and colleges

#### [**Think Stats: Exploratory Data Analysis in Python**](https://greenteapress.com/thinkstats2/html/index.html) **- Textbook**

> This text is an introduction to the practical tools of exploratory data analysis

#### [**Probably Overthinking It: Data Science and Bayesian Statistics**](https://www.allendowney.com/blog/) **- Blog**

> A blog series by Allen Downey, a curriculum designer at Brilliant, professor emeritus at Olin College, and author of Think Python, Think Bayes, and other books

#### [**50 years of Data Science**](https://courses.csail.mit.edu/18.337/2015/docs/50YearsDataScience.pdf) **- Article**

> An article based on a presentation from the 2015 Tukey Centennial workshop reviewing the last 50 years of Data Science and its emergence from the fields of statistics and machine learning
